episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of quirky historical and contemporary facts, including unusual Olympic events, a Victorian song named after Tony Blair, the eccentric first president of the UK's Women's Institute, and a study on social priming involving magnets.

facts.fact: The Olympics used to have a race just for old ladies.
There was a Victorian comic song that was called Tony Blair.
The first president of the UK's Women's Institute used a frying pan as a whip, wore an entire stuffed owl on her head and officially named the city of Canberra.
You can make yourself more attractive to members of the opposite sex by giving them a magnet.
